frameDefinitions: An Agent behaves as if they were a particular individual or type of Simulated_entity with the intent of misleading observers of their behavior.
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
A Protagonist is awake at some Time and Place.
An Agent produces a Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of)  a Standard.
A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
An Agent or Cause causes a Sleeper to transition from the Sleep_state to wakeful consciousness.
frameExamples: The belfast bank robbers <t>posed</t> as police.
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
So who was it that <t>faked</t> the photo 'showing' Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?
The earthquake <t>woke</t> me from a nightmare.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that they are a particular individual or type of <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The type or individual that the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression of being.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> impersonates the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives the impression that they are the <fen>Simulated_entity</fen>.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The entity that is not sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is awake.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Forgery</fen> is the product that the <fen>Agent</fen> creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to pass the <fen>Forgery</fen> off as.
The time at which the forgery takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a <fen>Forgery</fen>.
<fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
The person or being that is sleeping.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
<fex>She</fex> was awake through the whole football game.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Sunday in the Park with George, Into the Woods and Passion –
A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
